summaryOfNewsArticle: The National Digital Identity Authority (NDIA) has launched a new policy requiring all financial institutions, e-commerce platforms, and government services to implement secure digital identity verification by April 1, 2024. The policy aims to combat identity fraud and enhance the security of online transactions. The rollout is scheduled in phases to ensure a smooth transition. Key stakeholders include banks, credit unions, and major online retailers, all of which must comply with standardized protocols to ensure consistency and security across digital services. The policy is expected to be fully enforced by December 31, 2024, with ongoing monitoring by the NDIA to ensure compliance.
title: New Digital Identity Verification Policy Set to Take Effect in April 2024
